config.question: Why did the army face problems of equipment and supply at the start of the war?

choices.content: About a million volunteers signed up and the military did not have enough modern equipment for everyone.
Most of the volunteers did not have any training and were incapable of using the modern Mausers.
The Spanish had captured Hawaii and blocked the steady supply of munitions that shipped from the islands.
The Spanish destroyed most of the American military bases and naval outposts during the first two weeks of war.

answer_3.response: In an army inundated with men, problems of equipment and supply quickly appeared. The regulars had the new .30-caliber Krag-Jorgensen rifles, but National Guard units carried Civil War Springfield rifles that used old black-powder cartridges.
